oai_dc:dc.dc:title: New York National Guard "Excelsior" insignia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: New York National Guard "Excelsior" insignia composed of a shield featuring an effulgent sun and an American flag with an eagle on top of the shield. At the time of the Civil War, the design was most commonly associated with the Excelsior Brigade in the; Army of the Potomac. The brigade consisted of volunteer infantry regiments raised in New York by former U. S. Congressman and Civil War General Daniel Sickles. They contributed to many important battles, including Chancellorsville and Gettysburg.
